Class Particle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Particle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChargedParticle

    public class Particle
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    A Class to represent a massive particle It can have position, velocity, acceleration and mass
    Version:
    1.6
    Author:
    Alex Finch, Ian Bailey

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(java.lang.Object other)
      Compares a Particle with position (p2) to 'this' Particle's position (p1) and determines which has the largest absolute value of the y coordinate of position.

                PhysicsVector positionIn,

        Constructor that sets mass, position and velocity
        Parameters:
        mIn - mass of the particle
        positionIn - initial position of particle
        velocityIn - initial velocity of particle

      • update

        public void update(double deltaTime,
                   PhysicsVector accelIn)
        Update the position and velocity of the particle subject to a constant acceleration for a time. After the time has passed the acceleration reverts to its previous value.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - The change in time
        accelIn - The applied acceleration

      • updateEuler1

        public void updateEuler1(double deltaTime,
                         PhysicsVector accelIn)

      • updateEuler2

        public void updateEuler2(double deltaTime,
                         PhysicsVector accelIn)

      • update

        public void update(double deltaTime)
        Update the position and velocity of the particle after a short time has passed when the particle is experiencing the acceleration stored in the class. Applies the formula s = ut + 1/2 at**2 to the position Applies the formula v=u+at to the velocity
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - The change in time

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Create a string containing the mass, position, velocity, and acceleration of the particle. This method is called automatically by System.out.println(someparticle)
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string with the format " mass "+mass+" Position: "+position+" Velocity: "+velocity+" Acceleration: "+acceleration

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object other)
              throws java.lang.ClassCastException
        Compares a Particle with position (p2) to 'this' Particle's position (p1) and determines which has the largest absolute value of the y coordinate of position.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Returns:
        -1 if |p2|>|p1|, 0 if |p2|==|p1|, 1 otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException
